DOCNAME: POLAK SPOL. S R.O.  v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Margarita Tsatsa-Nikolovska;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Snejana Botoucharova;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: The applicant , ORG . s.r.o . , is a limited liability company incorporated under NORP law with its registered office in GPE . The company was created on DATE and has CARDINAL members , PERSON , GPE and GPE It was represented before the ORG by its incorporated agent , ORG . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the ORG ( okresní soud ) , following an action brought by a certain S. on DATE , ordered P.P. to pay CZK MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) to the claimant . On DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) upheld this judgment . On DATE S. invited P.P. to comply with the judgment , but the latter did not reply .
In the meantime , on DATE , P.P. and his wife had sold their immovable property to the applicant company . The purchase contract was supplemented on DATE .

On DATE S. brought an action against the applicant company , P.P. and his wife , seeking a declaration that the sale contract was legally unenforceable ( smlouva právně neúčinná ) . The case was assigned to a ORG judge who had been involved in the previous proceedings .
On DATE ORG granted the applicant company ’s challenge for bias and excluded ORG judge from the examination of the case .

In a judgment of DATE ORG held that the sale contract was legally unenforceable in respect of S. , who was entitled to claim that the debt of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL awarded by ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE be satisfied by the sale of the immovable property .

On DATE ORG , following the GPE appeals , modified this judgment in that it dismissed the action in respect of P.P. and his wife . It upheld the remaining part of the judgment . On DATE ORG rectified a typing error in its judgment concerning the description of the immovable property at issue . Although the applicant company was represented by a new lawyer , the court mentioned its previous legal representative .

On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision , mentioning the correct lawyer . It dismissed the appeals of ORG and his wife directed against the first instance judgment of DATE as amended by the decision of CARDINAL DATE . It upheld the verdict of ORG in respect of the applicant company but held that PERSON had been entitled to request that his recoverable claim vis - à - vis the applicant company be satisfied by selling the building lot .
ORG judgment became effective on DATE .
On DATE the second defendant filed an appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) . The first and third defendants appealed on points of law on DATE .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed the CARDINAL appeals on points of law holding , in respect of GPE and the applicant company , that they had filed their appeals outside the one month statutory time - limit as provided for in LAW .

In the meantime , on DATE , P.P. and the applicant company had filed a constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) requesting ORG ( GPE soud ) to quash ORG judgment of DATE and ORG judgment of DATE . They supplemented it on DATE challenging ORG decision of DATE . The applicant company and ORG alleged a violation of their rights guaranteed by Articles CARDINAL , DATE and CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( right to judicial and other legal protection ) of GPE ( Listina základních práv a svobod )
On DATE ORG declared the constitutional appeal manifestly ill - founded .

On DATE ORG received the applicant company ’s second constitutional appeal in which it sought to quash ORG decision of DATE , ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE and ORG judgment of DATE , alleging a violation of their right to judicial protection under ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the LAW .

On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal stating that it had been , in respect of the CARDINAL first decisions , lodged outside the DATE time - limit laid down by LAW . As far as the remaining part of the appeal directed against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE was concerned , the court found it unsubstantiated .
Both of the high courts wrongly identified the applicant ’s seat .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
